Proclamation Series of 14 Proclamation number 128 Honoring the Tuskegee Airmen Mile High Flight Program Day on February 24th to honor the Tuskegee Airmen, the first black military pilots in the United States.'

'speaker_5': 'Whereas in 1941, Congress mandated the creation of an all black army combat unit and subsequently a fighter squadron was formed at the Tuskegee Institute for 250 enlisted men that became the famed Tuskegee Airmen. And. WHEREAS, the Hubert Al Hooks Jones chapter, Tuskegee Airman maintains the legacy of the much decorated black heroes of World War Two through education'

'speaker_5': 'on the endurance, exploits and achievements of the Tuskegee Airmen and through mentoring activities with young people about career opportunities in the aviation industry. And. Whereas, the group exposes hundreds of minority junior and senior high school students to opportunities designed to increase minority representation in the aviation aerospace industry, including field trips, airplane and glider flights, and training for'

'speaker_5': 'a select few to fly solo through the Mile High Flight program. And. Whereas, Colorado is proud to be the home of the Hubert Al Hooks Jones chapter of the Tuskegee Airmen Inc, one of 54 chapters in major cities and military installations across the country dedicated to motivating your Americans to pursue excellence and careers in aviation and aerospace'

'speaker_5': '. And. Whereas, the community is proud of the legacy of the Tuskegee Airmen, especially those living in Colorado who refuse to allow adversity to diminish their spirit in their quest for equality for all people. Now, therefore, be it proclaimed by the Council of the City and County of Denver, Section one, the February 24th, 2014 is proclaimed Tuskegee Airman'

'speaker_5': 'Mile High Flight Program Day to celebrate and honor the Mile High Flight Program and the proud tradition of the Tuskegee Airmen whose noble and selfless actions have inspired generations to follow in their footsteps.
